Course Description: This course deals with the design and study of error-detecting and error-correcting codes for the reliable transmission/storage of data over noisy communication channels.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Ability to explain theory of several classes of linear and non-linear codes Ability to construct a new code with better parameters from a code with given parameters
Course Outcomes.CO2: Ability to explain the main coding theory problem and bounds in coding theory
Course Outcomes.CO3: Ability to explain encoding and decoding procedures of several classical families of error-correcting codes
Course Outcomes.CO4: Ability to explain encoding and decoding procedures of several classical families of error-correcting codes

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Error-correcting codes: Error detection, error correction, communication channels, maximum likelihood decoding, Hamming distance, nearest neighbour decoding, distance of a code.
Linear codes: Generator and parity-check matrices, equivalence of Linear codes, encoding with a linear code, Syndrome decoding. Weight enumerators and the MacWilliams identity.

Bounds in coding theory: The main coding theory problem, sphere-covering bound, Gilbert-Varshamov bound, Hamming bound and perfect codes, Hamming codes, Golay codes, Singleton bound and MDS codes, Plotkin bound, Griesmer bound.
Nonlinear codes, Weight enumerators and MacWillimas identity.
Hadamard matrix codes and Nordstrom-Robinson code.
Construction of linear codes: Propagation rules, Reed-Muller codes, Subfield codes.
